testsuite.name: Scenario: Use an uninstalled version of an uninstalled candidate updates the candidate _HOME variable

testcase.name: Given the internet is reachable
testcase.classname: Scenario: Use an uninstalled version of an uninstalled candidate updates the candidate _HOME variable

testcase.name: And an initialised environment
testcase.classname: Scenario: Use an uninstalled version of an uninstalled candidate updates the candidate _HOME variable

testcase.name: Given the candidate "grails" does not exist locally
testcase.classname: Scenario: Use an uninstalled version of an uninstalled candidate updates the candidate _HOME variable

testcase.name: And the candidate "grails" version "2.1.0" is available for download
testcase.classname: Scenario: Use an uninstalled version of an uninstalled candidate updates the candidate _HOME variable

testcase.name: And the system is bootstrapped
testcase.classname: Scenario: Use an uninstalled version of an uninstalled candidate updates the candidate _HOME variable

testcase.name: And the "GRAILS_HOME" variable is not set
testcase.classname: Scenario: Use an uninstalled version of an uninstalled candidate updates the candidate _HOME variable

testcase.name: When I enter "sdk use grails 2.1.0" and answer "Y"
testcase.classname: Scenario: Use an uninstalled version of an uninstalled candidate updates the candidate _HOME variable

testcase.name: Then the "GRAILS_HOME" variable contains "grails/2.1.0"
testcase.classname: Scenario: Use an uninstalled version of an uninstalled candidate updates the candidate _HOME variable
